==Lore==
Leschots Clockwork Shop, also simply called Leschots's workshop, is run by Livre, who creates mechanical clockwork toys. [[Alberre]] and [[Arbon]] are employees of the workshop,<ref name="Shots Fired">{{Ref/Quest|The Toy War: Shots Fired}}</ref> while [[Freminet]] has been commissioned to create toy designs.<ref>{{Ref/NPC|Livre}}</ref>

Livre maintains a rivalry with his younger brother, [[Caron]], who owns Lepaute Horlogerie and dabbles into making clockwork toys as a side gig from his usual business of designing clocks.<ref name="Shots Fired" />

==Trivia==
===Etymology===
* The workshop may take its name from various Swiss watchmakers and mechanists named Leschot.
** Jean-Frédéric Leschot was the protégé of {{W|Pierre Jaquet-Droz}}, who together with Jaquet-Droz's son Henri-Louis produced numerous watches, automata and other mechanisms; such as the three {{W|Jaquet-Droz automata}}.
